intro: Cirsium hakkaricum, commonly known as the Kurdish thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and northern Syria. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid soils, thriving in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are deeply lobed and covered in coarse hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Cirsium hakkaricum is often found in open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
